div.a: NASCAR Crash Injures Spectators

div.div: Tony Stewart won today's race at Daytona, but all anyone will remember is how it ended for another driver, Kyle Larson. A massive wreck at the checkered flag sent Larson's car through the catch fence, sending debris and even the car's engine itself hurtling toward spectators.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZAg4ee&via=Digg&text=NASCAR Crash Injures Spectators

div.div: AT LEAST ACCORDING TO THE GIFs

div.a: Microsoft's Console Announcement Should Be Right Around The Corner

div.div: Scuttlebutt has it that Microsoft is eyeballing an April date to reveal its next console, in an event similar to what Sony held for the PS4 on Wednesday.

div.div: WE WOULD LIKE TO LIVE THERE

div.a: Fascinating Futuristic Megalopolises

div.div: If China ever built cities like this, we would move there immediately.

div.div: SHOULDN'T HAVE SAID ANYTHING AT ALL

div.a: So, North Korea Phoned The U.S. And Didn't Have Anything Nice To Say

div.div: It's rare that our friends from North Korea actually pick up the phone and give the ol' U.S. a call. But according to reports in their local media that's exactly what they did. Oh, and did we mention it was to warn the U.S. they would meet a "miserable destruction"?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13dgYhw&via=Digg&text=So, North Korea Phoned The U.S. And Didn't Have Anything Nice To Say

div.div: ALSO CREEPILY CLAIMING TO BE YOUR FATHER

div.a: The New York Yankees Actually Trademarked 'Evil Empire'

div.div: Fans of the New York Yankees might bristle when they hear their team referred to as the "Evil Empire." But the team itself doesn't seem to mind, at least judging from a recent legal dust-up over the phrase.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X33ksh&via=Digg&text=The New York Yankees Actually Trademarked 'Evil Empire'

div.a: Homeland Security Took Michael Arrington's Boat Because 'America Is Myspace'

div.div: All TechCrunch founder Michael Arrington wanted was a simple life, with a simple boat, so that he might draw out his remaining days in peaceful aquatic seclusion.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Zqaozx&via=Digg&text=Homeland Security Took Michael Arrington's Boat Because 'America Is Myspace'

div.div: Apple, Twitter, Facebook, Microsoft, Tumblr, Burger King, Jeep, The New York Times. The cybersecurity reckoning is here, and it's been a long time coming.

div.a: This Car Runs Entirely On Coffee

div.div: This amazing car is run by pellets made of coffee-grinding byproducts. We may have just saved humanity.

div.div: ANOTHER WAY TO LOSE A LIMB

div.a: A Snowboard With A Heart Of Glass

div.div: There are many reasons why a glass snowboard is a bad idea. And yet everything about Signal Snowboards’ glass Park Board, from its design and production to its execution and performance, is awesome.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wdz6Rc&via=Digg&text=A Snowboard With A Heart Of Glass

div.a: Training Child Survivalists

div.div: You feel a moment. I’m not certain if it’s a second lost or a second gained, but in that moment the Earth stops. It’s the moment you watch a child, a young girl in purple shoes, pull a loaded AK-47 assault rifle from the cab of a pick-up truck.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YHzed2&via=Digg&text=Training Child Survivalists

div.a: The True Story Of History's Only Known Meteorite Victim

div.div: The Russian meteorite, whose sonic boom damaged buildings and injured more than a thousand last week, is not the first to shatter a human life.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WScbgl&via=Digg&text=The True Story Of History's Only Known Meteorite Victim

div.a: Boxing Cats Filmed By Thomas Edison In 1894

div.div: This short film was shot at the world's first movie studio, The Black Maria, located in West Orange, NJ. The entire building was built on a turntable so that the building could rotate with the sun for the best lighting conditions.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11ZUAc4&via=Digg&text=Boxing Cats Filmed By Thomas Edison In 1894
